text: Hello everyone, Charles here! Glad to have a place for CFO discussions.
Hi Charles! Alice from Finex Solutions checking in.
David from Alpha Finance. Good to meet you all.
Has anyone used SAP for consolidation? We are considering it.
George here. Yes, we implemented SAP last year. Mixed results so far.
We use Workday for HR and financials; simpler than SAP in my opinion.
Peter from NorthStar. We are an Oracle shop, but always curious about alternatives.
Fiona here at Lionheart Consulting. We help clients evaluate these solutions if you need insights.
Richard from Crown. We run QuickBooks for smaller subsidiaries, SAP for the main HQ.
Elizabeth from Britannia. Good to meet all of you! We also have SAP— might share experiences soon.
Claudia from Alpha. It’s nice to see multiple SAP users. Let’s compare notes sometime.
Kicking off a new thread: Anyone tried Xero for mid-sized entities?
Helen from Summit. Yes, we love Xero for real-time bank feeds and multi-currency support.
I second that. Xero is user-friendly and cost-effective.
Charles: We might test Xero for a smaller division. Any big pitfalls to watch out for?
Just watch out for advanced consolidation features. Not as robust as SAP/Oracle.
We’ve done a pilot with NetSuite. Higher cost, but good for complex structures.
Elizabeth: We’re evaluating NetSuite vs Workday. Hard to decide, so any feedback is welcomed.
Claudia: NetSuite is strong in multi-entity but can be pricy. We chose SAP over it though.
George: We have an internal doc comparing these solutions. Happy to share if needed.
Yes please, that doc could be super helpful for new CFOs here.
Richard: I’ll DM you our notes on Oracle Cloud vs NetSuite as well.
Awesome collaboration, folks.
Charles: Revisiting Workday. Are you all satisfied with its budgeting module?
Alice: We’re mostly happy, though custom reporting can get tricky.
George: The real benefit is tight integration with HR. If that’s valuable, Workday is good.
Peter: We are purely Oracle, but always curious to learn about Workday’s expansions.
Elizabeth: We plan a pilot next quarter. Will share experience then!
Any CFO meetups in London next month? Always looking to connect.
Helen: We have a small CFO roundtable on Feb 5th in Birmingham, all invited!
Alice: Count me in! Could we get details please?
Helen: Sure thing, will DM you. It’s a half-day event followed by networking.
David: We also have a quick meetup in Manchester on Feb 20th. Let me know if interested.
Charles: Great! I’ll drive up for that. Thanks for sharing.
Claudia: We’re hosting a CFO charity golf event in April 2021. Let me know if you want in.
Richard: That sounds fun. I’d love more details.
George: Let’s all go! CFOs + golf = deals on the course.
Peter: Sign me up too. We’ll bring a few of our VPs.
Alice: Quick question: best practice for IFRS 16 compliance in SAP? Any tips appreciated.
Fiona: We consult on IFRS 16. Might have a quick reference doc. Let me check.
Alice: Thanks, Fiona. Perfect timing.
Claudia: Our compliance took 2 months to fully implement. Key is correct lease data setup.
David: Same experience. Let me know if you want to see our checklist.
Charles: Considering a switch from QuickBooks to NetSuite for a new acquisition. Thoughts?
Richard: We did that. NetSuite handles growth better, but the cost jump is big.
Helen: I prefer Xero for small acquisitions, but if they’re big, NetSuite might be worth it.
David: We have a migration guide if needed, let me know.
Elizabeth: We’ll be watching closely. Keep us posted on your transition.
Peter: Maybe do a pilot first to confirm the ROI.
Charles: Great tips everyone, I appreciate it!
